title: PESTEL Analysis
content:
Module 3, Lesson 2: PESTEL Analysis

Introduction

This lesson covers PESTEL Analysis as part of the Strategic Planning module in the Learn Management course. Mastery of this topic is essential for building a comprehensive understanding of the subject area.

Key Concepts

In PESTEL Analysis, you will explore the foundational ideas, practical techniques, and real-world applications that make this area of study both relevant and actionable. Each concept has been carefully selected to build on prior knowledge and prepare you for more advanced topics.

Practical Application

Understanding PESTEL Analysis means being able to apply these principles in professional contexts. You will encounter scenarios, case studies, and examples drawn from real industry practice, helping you translate theory into competence.

Summary

You have completed PESTEL Analysis (Strategic Planning, Lesson 2). Proceed to the quiz to test your understanding, then continue to the next lesson to build further expertise.

quiz.question: What is a SWOT analysis?
options: Assessment of Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats

quiz.question: Porter's Five Forces analyses which of the following?
What is the Balanced Scorecard?
options: A performance measurement framework across four perspectives

quiz.question: What is competitive strategy according to Porter?
options: Choosing cost leadership, differentiation, or focus

quiz.question: What does PESTEL stand for?
options: Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Environmental, Legal
People, Events, Systems, Technology, Enterprises, Logistics
Planning, Executing, Sustaining, Tracking, Evaluating, Learning
